answer:
In B.C., the routine vaccine program for chickenpox (varicella) is two doses given at 12 months and 4-6 years of age. If your child received two doses of chickenpox vaccine at 1 and 5 years of age, they are considered up to date. 
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## In B.
C.
, the routine vaccine program for chickenpox (varicella) is two doses given at 12 months and 4-6 years of age.

If your child received two doses of chickenpox vaccine at 1 and 5 years of age, they are considered up to date.
Immunization Nurse
question: My child got the chicken pox vaccine at 1 year and 5 year. Does she need another one?
